page.title: 20OTTERTON CHURCH (St.Michael)
page.content: There is one place of worship in Otterton, the Parish Church, called St. Michael's. It was so named because {William the Conqueror}gave the Church and its Priory to the monks of Mont St. Michel, of his home Normandy. The Church was mostly re-built in 1870 and is large for the size of the village. The tower is much older and is built of red stone. The Vicar in 1985 is the Revd. Bill Turnbull. He was the first Vicar to have two parishes to look after; Colaton Raleigh as well as Otterton. Next to the Church is the village school, which is a Church of England Primary School. Also next to the Church is an old manor house, re-built by a Mr. Duke from money he got after the closing of the monasteries in the 1530s.
